result.execSummary:
All charges against Anthony LaSalle McIntosh in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Anthony LaSalle McIntosh is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Anthony LaSalle McIntosh

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Anthony LaSalle McIntosh in court.  Attorney Matthew V Plummer in court for Anthony LaSalle McIntosh.  Prosecuting attorney Michael J. Odden in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a Jury Trial.  State's witness is not available and the State is unable to proceed. Defense moves to dismiss the case. Court ordered case dismissed.

Defendant Anthony LaSalle McIntosh appeared by video.  Attorney Matthew V Plummer appeared by video for Anthony LaSalle McIntosh.  Prosecuting attorney Jacob A. Maule in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Final pretrial proceeded.  State's offer stated on the record.  Defense rejects State's offer.  Case remains in jury trial posture.  Case is adjourned to 10-31-22 at 8:30 am for Jury Trial.

Attorney Matthew V Plummer in court.  Michelle A. Grasso appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
  Defense is requesting final pretrial and jury trial dates. Case is adjourned to 9-15-22 at 8:30 am for final pretrial and 10-31-22 at 8:30 am for jury trial.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Matthew V Plummer in court, defendant Anthony LaSalle McIntosh not in court, in custody.  Jacob A. Maule appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
Defendant has a pending felony matter. Defense is requesting a status conference.  Case is adjourned to 8-17-22 at 8:30 am for status conference.
  This hearing may be streamed live on DAcast at the discretion of the Court:
https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/d84cd54a-763c-3a58-15a9-b84acf306616  Status conference scheduled for August 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Matthew V Plummer in court, defendant Anthony LaSalle McIntosh not in court, in custody.  Jacob A. Maule appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Parties are still negotiating and requesting a status conference hearing date.  Case is adjourned to 7-21-22 at 1:30 pm for status conference.
  This hearing may be streamed live on DAcast at the discretion of the Court:
https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/d84cd54a-763c-3a58-15a9-b84acf306616  Status conference scheduled for July 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Anthony LaSalle McIntosh in court with attorney Matthew V Plummer.  Ryan Jay Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Pretrial Conference held.  Defense counsel was recently appointed on this case and requests an additional status conference date.  Case adjourned, Br. 10.  Status conference scheduled for June 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no contact with T.L.G. or her children
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.    The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

ADDRESS INFO for Anthony LaSalle McIntosh
Current: 3281 N 58th St, Milwaukee, WI 53216   (Effective: 04-25-2022)
Prior: 4417 West Glendale Avenue, Milwaukee, WI 53218

Defendant Anthony LaSalle McIntosh in court with attorney Sam Obscherning.  Defendant Anthony LaSalle McIntosh in custody.  Claire Louise Starling appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Anthony LaSalle McIntosh appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Havas, Branch 10.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast: https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/76b667a0-98a1-69d4-e783-9185dc35fcc1  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
